attributes.action: halt the Academies programme and improve the standard of all schools so that most parents chose to send their children to the school nearest to their home.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Academies cost £24-27 million each to build whereas other new state schools cost £20-22 million. There is no evidence of academic perfomance justifying this difference in cost. Even if there was, why should not all parents have a school of that quality as the one nearest to their home? And what about the environmemtal implications: why is there so much concern about food miles and apparently none about school miles?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
